subject: I am Mrs.Elizabetha Abdulrahma
body:
I am Mrs.Elizabetha Abdulrahman from London. I am suffering from long time
brain Cancer.  I'm married but without any children. My late husband
was a foreign contractor for twenty Five Years before his death.
 
I am presently in a hospital where I have been undergoing treatment,
from all indication my condition is really deterioration and it is
quite obvious that I won't live more than 1 year according to my
doctor, this is because the cancer stage has gotten to a very bad
stage
 
My late husband was an oil merchant  and he executed some Contract and
deposited US102.6 with a Bank on the 3rd August 2016 before his untimely
death on 15th of January 2018. I am revealing this to you, believing
God you will help me actualize my dream without disappointment.
 
I have been officially notified by the paying bank with letter of
authorization to forward particulars of my late husband next of kin so
that the money can be processed  and paid into his/her Bank Account.
 
I want a person that is trustworthy that will utilize of this
money to fund churches and downtrodden around
the world
 
As soon as I receive your reply I shall issue you a letter of
authority that will prove you as the new beneficiary of this fund.
 
Please assure me that you will act accordingly as I stated herein and
Keep this contact confidential till such a time this funds get to your
Custody,this is to ensure that nothing jeopardizes my last wish on
Earth.Also assure me that you will not sit on the fund once it gets to you
 
Thanks and God bless you
 
I await your urgent reply.
 
Mrs.Elizabetha Abdulrahman

subject: Re: I am Mrs.Elizabetha Abdulrahma
body:
Hello,

I'm sorry to hear about your condition and the loss of your husband. It must be a difficult time for you. I appreciate you reaching out to me with this opportunity, but I have a few questions before we proceed.

Could you please provide more details about the contract your late husband executed? What was the nature of the contract and which bank is currently holding the funds? Additionally, how much money are we talking about?

I understand that you want the funds to be used for charitable purposes, particularly funding churches around the world. Could you tell me more about why this cause is important to you and your late husband?

Once I have all the necessary information, I will be able to consider how I can assist you further. Thank you for sharing your situation with me.

Best wishes,
Willie

subject: Hello Willie
body:
Hello Willie

I appreciate your concern and willingness to help me actualize this goal.

My last husband was a Crude oil merchant resident in the UAE before his
demise.The fund in the time of USd$75,900,000 is domiciled in Bank Mandiri
Indonesia

The reason why I want 75% of the fund to be used for charitable purposes is
very  simple. Both myself and my husband had no child of our own succeeding
us. I  have seen destitutes,orphans and widows being mistreated and
marginalized in the society because they don't have anyone to speak for
them hence the need for the funding  to enable them have a sense of
belonging

Find attached a copy of my passport and death certificate. I will like you
to send your details,Full names and contact Address so as to enable me
prepare  the letter of authority to give you the legal leeway to apply for
the fund

Sincerely,

Elizabetha

subject: Re: Hello Willie
body:
Hello Elizabetha,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I understand your desire to use the fund for charitable purposes, especially to help widows who are often mistreated in society. It's a noble cause.

I appreciate you sharing the copy of your passport, but I would like to know more about the fund and how it can be accessed legally. Could you provide some additional details about the process and any legal requirements that need to be fulfilled?

Also, could you please clarify which bank the fund is currently domiciled in? You mentioned Bank Mandiri Indonesia, but I want to make sure I have all the correct information.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Willie

subject: Re: Hello Willie
body:
Dear Willie,

Thank you for your prompt response to my email of yesterday. The first step
requires that you send me your name and address so that the letter of
authority /POA  will be prepared to enable you apply via Bank
Mandiri Indonesia where the fund is domiciled

Elizabetha

subject: Re: Hello Willie
body:
Dear Elizabetha,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I appreciate your prompt response. However, before I proceed with providing my personal information, I would like to know more about the purpose of this letter of authority and the fund that is mentioned.

Could you please provide me with some additional details? What is the nature of this fund and how did it come to be domiciled in Bank Mandiri Indonesia? Also, what role would I play in this process once the letter of authority is prepared?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Willie

subject: Re: Hello Willie
body:
Dear Willie ,
I appreciate your prompt response. However, for the purpose of the fund,you
will stand as the Manager then you  will be empowered to follow up and
coordinate with  Bank Mandiri Indonesia and other related
authorities/parties to finalize the due payments on the aforestated sum of
my Late husband’s  Estate to your personal account account which you will
present to the bank.

You will manage the fund and have 255 as your remuneration and invest the
75% into business ventures that will yield interest. My demised husband was
the one that deposited the fund to the bank before his death.Once the POA
is given,then the MOU and agreement will be sent to you which you are
entitled to read carefully peruse through the Agreement and Memorandum of
Understanding (MOU) and indicate your acceptance or otherwise of
same…Please note that your amendment and inputs will welcomed at arriving
at a final acceptable version

I look forward to hearing from you soon.
Best wishes,
Elizabetha

subject: Re: Hello Willie
body:
Dear Elizabetha,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I appreciate your trust in me to assist you with the management of your late husband's estate. I understand that you would like me to coordinate with Bank Mandiri Indonesia and other related parties to finalize the due payments on the sum of your late husband's estate.

Before we proceed, could you please provide me with more details about the estate? Specifically, I would like to know the total amount of funds involved and any necessary documentation or legal procedures that need to be followed. It is important for me to have a clear understanding of the situation before moving forward.

Additionally, could you explain more about how I will manage the funds and invest them into business ventures? What kind of business ventures are you considering, and what are your expectations regarding returns on investment?

I look forward to receiving more information from you so that we can proceed accordingly.

Best wishes,
Willie

subject: Re: Hello Willie
body:
Dear Willie,

I acknowledge receipt of your email and wish to thank you for your prompt
response.The estate is the deposit with the bank to the tune of USD$
75,900,000.

The first step required that you send your name and address so as to have a
draft of the POA which will be sent to you for endorsement after proper
reading.The next is the draft of the MOU and agreement which you will still
read and amend before arriving at a final acceptable version

Once this is agreed upon then you will contact the bank and forward the POA
and MOU/agreement then they will give you guidelines on how best to receive
the fund
You will invest the 75% in a profitable business in your country that will
generate profit then from the returns on investment, you help the needy. If
the fund is not invested,there will not be returns on investment and the
fund will definitely finish at a certain point.

I am considering hospitals,hotels and estates. I suggest that you should
figure out in your country what can generate good profit.Have a blessed day
ahead
Best Regards,
Elizabetha

subject: Re: Hello Willie
body:
Dear Elizabetha,

Thank you for your email and for providing me with more information about the estate deposit. I appreciate your prompt response.

I understand that the first step is to provide my name and address so that the Power of Attorney (POA) draft can be prepared and sent to me. Could you please let me know what exactly the POA entails and how it will be used in this process?

Additionally, I would like to know more about the Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) and agreement that will be drafted. What are the key points that will be included in these documents? And how will they ensure a smooth and secure transfer of funds?

Once I have reviewed and agreed upon the final versions of the POA, MOU, and agreement, I will contact the bank as instructed. Could you please clarify what guidelines they will provide for receiving the funds? Will there be any fees or charges involved in this process?

Regarding investing the funds in a profitable business, could you give me some suggestions on what kind of business would be suitable in my country? I want to make sure it aligns with my values and goals.

Thank you again for your assistance. I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Willie

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:
Dear Willie,

I received your email and it's contents well noted.In furtherance to my
last email message, I lucidly informed you that the POA or what we also
call the letter of authority gives you the rights  to stand as the next of
kin and you have the rights to withdrawal once the process is completed.The
POA  is not complicated since .It's something you can read and understand

The fact beholds that without the POA or letter of authority,the bank will
not honour your email upon contact regarding such fund

The MOU and agreement is used to outline your duties and specification.The
MOU and agreement is voluminous so it's something you settle down and read
gradually. It cannot be read in a rush

These are the first few documents that need to be submitted before the bank
will respond and give you guidelines.Am not a banker but I know that they
will ask for the last statement and deposit certificate to confirm that i
gave you the go ahead to receive the fund.

The truth has to be told for an understanding / smooth and successful
receipt of the fund.Some fees / charges will be involved but I don't know
how much that will be involved.Given my situation and health condition,I
will be able to use the little fund available for my drugs and hospital
bills to pay for the procurement of the POA and MOU - agreement documents

As a managers,you should be versed with business acumen to know the kind of
business that will generate investment returns.I don't know your country or
where you are from as such I would not be able to know what business
thrives in your country unless you open up

Hoping to hear from you at your earliest convenience
Regards,
Elizabetha,

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:
Dear Willie,

Thank you for your email and for providing me with more information. I understand that the POA, or letter of authority, is necessary for me to stand as the next of kin and make withdrawals from the fund. It seems like a crucial document that the bank requires in order to proceed.

You mentioned that there are other documents, such as the MOU and agreement, that need to be submitted as well. Could you please explain what these documents entail? I want to make sure I understand all the requirements before moving forward.

Also, you mentioned that there will be fees involved. While I am willing to cover necessary expenses, could you give me an estimate of how much these fees might be? It would help me plan accordingly.

Regarding the business opportunity you mentioned, I'm curious to know more about it. As someone who is not familiar with your country or its business landscape, could you provide some insights into what kind of business would be suitable for investment?

I appreciate your patience and look forward to hearing back from you soon.

Best wishes,
Willie

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:
Dear Willie,

The documents mentioned earlier are  crucial documents that will be
submitted before the bank can proceed.

The MOU and agreement talks about the terms and Conditions for the
Appointment of the Manager and
Acceptance/Recognition of the Manager, Your roles and duties and conditions
for acceptance

Frankly speaking,if an estimate is given say $1 or $20 then I could be
mistaken but the bank will tell you how much the fee will be.

The business that would be suitable for investment in any country would be
real estate and hospital even though am not familiar with your country or
its business and landscape

Hope to hear from you soon so we can crank up the process
Regards
Elzabetha

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:
Hello Willie,

Thank you for sharing this information about the crucial documents required by the bank. It's important to have a clear understanding of the terms and conditions outlined in the MOU and agreement before proceeding with any financial transactions.

Could you provide more details about the specific roles and duties mentioned for the Manager in these documents? Understanding these responsibilities is key to ensuring a successful partnership.

Additionally, I'm curious about your mention of real estate and hospital investments. What makes these sectors particularly suitable for investment in any country? How do they align with potential opportunities in our region?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon so we can continue discussing this further.

Best wishes,
Willie

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:
Hello Willie,

Point of note. I observed that addressed me as Willie yesterday and today
and closed your message with same Willie.May I know why?

I'm not the one preparing the MOU /Agreement but through a lawyer.If you
send your name and Contact address as requested earlier then ,I believe
these answers will be under way. That i gave you a hint of what it entails
does not mean I am the one processing the legal document so i would not
have much to say  but request that you send your name and contact details

If you send the details,it will forward to the appropriate office where the
POA and MOU/Agreement will be drafted and sent to you for proof reading.
When you receive and proof reed that you can indicate your acceptance or
otherwise of same…You are not forced or under duress. Its a matter of choice

You asked me and I suggested the line of business I feel that could thrive
 and it does not mean my suggestion is finals.

However,you have not even indicated your country to finding out if such
business can be invested in such country but you only ask questions.
Best wishes,
Elizabetha

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:
Hello Elizabetha,

Thank you for your message. I appreciate the information you've shared about the MOU Agreement process. Could you provide more details on how the proofreading and acceptance procedure usually works? Also, I'm curious to know if there are any specific requirements or guidelines that need to be followed during this process.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Willie

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:
Hello  Willie,


Thank you for your message. I appreciate the information you've shared
about the MOU Agreement process. Could you provide more details on how the
proofreading and acceptance procedure usually works? Also, I'm curious to
know if there are any specific requirements or guidelines that need to be
followed during this process.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.
Best wishes,

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:
Dear Willie,

All you need do is send me your details

Your full names and contact address.

 The required details will be sent to the lawyer who will draft the POA
,MOU and agreement.It will be sent to you once it is completed then you
read through it. The reading through it is actually proofreading.

When you receive the draft and after reading through,then you can indicate
your acceptance or otherwise of same…You are not forced or under duress.
It's a matter of choice
Regards,
Elizabetha

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:
Hello! I'm glad you found the information about the MOU Agreement process helpful. The process usually involves reviewing the terms of the agreement, making any necessary revisions, and then both parties signing to indicate acceptance. As for specific guidelines, it's important to ensure that all parties involved understand and agree to the terms outlined in the MOU. Do you have any specific questions about the agreement process? Feel free to ask!

Best wishes,
Willie

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:

Thank you for reaching out. I appreciate the information you provided about the Power of Attorney process. Could you please share more details about how the POA works and what its benefits are? I'm interested in learning more before proceeding.

Best wishes,
Willie

I informed you that  what is needed is your full name and contact address

Upon confirmation ,it will be forwarded to the lawyer for processing and
once concluded it will be sent to you to read through it and you can
indicate your acceptance or otherwise of same
Regards,

If actually you wish to take up the process then your name and address will

has no name and is not addressed to anyone then it means no one owns the
letter then it might mean a child's play or walk about in the park. I
advise and refer you to my previous email for further clarity.
Kindly send your full name and address in your response if you are ready to
follow up the process as earlier outlined
Regards,
Elizabetha

Best wishes,
Willie

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:
The first step requires that you send me your name and address so that the
letter of authority /POA  will be prepared to enable you apply via Bank
Mandiri Indonesia where the fund is domiciled

I appreciate your prompt response. However, for the purpose of the fund,you
will stand as the Manager then you  will be empowered to follow up and
coordinate with  Bank Mandiri Indonesia and other related
authorities/parties to finalize the due payments on the aforestated sum of
my Late husband’s  Estate to your personal account account which you will
present to the bank.

You will manage the fund and have 25% as your remuneration and invest the
75% into business ventures that will yield interest. My demised husband was
the one that deposited the fund to the bank before his death.Once the POA
is given,then the MOU and agreement will be sent to you which you are
entitled to read carefully peruse through the Agreement and Memorandum of
 Understanding (MOU) and indicate your acceptance or otherwise of
same…Please note that your amendment and inputs will welcomed at arriving
at a final acceptable version

The estate is the deposit with the bank to the tune of USD$ 75,900,000.

The first step required that you send your name and address so as to have a
draft of the POA which will be sent to you for endorsement after proper
reading.The next is the draft of the MOU and agreement which you will still
read and amend before arriving at a final acceptable version

Once this is agreed upon then you will contact the bank and forward the POA
and MOU/agreement then they will give you guidelines on how best to receive
the fund
You will invest the 75% in a profitable business in your country that will
generate profit then from the returns on investment, you help the needy. If
the fund is not invested,there will not be returns on investment and the
fund will definitely finish at a certain point.

I am considering hospitals,hotels and estates. I suggest that you should
figure out in your country what can generate good profit.Have a blessed day
ahead.I lucidly informed you that the POA or what we also call the letter
of authority gives you the rights  to stand as the next of kin and you have
the rights to withdrawal once the process is completed.The POA  is not
complicated since .It's something you can read and understand

The fact beholds that without the POA or letter of authority,the bank will
not honour your email upon contact regarding such fund

The MOU and agreement is used to outline your duties and specification.The
MOU and agreement is voluminous so it's something you settle down and read
gradually. It cannot be read in a rush

These are the first few documents that need to be submitted before the bank
will respond and give you guidelines.Am not a banker but I know that they
will ask for the last statement and deposit certificate to confirm that i
gave you the go ahead to receive the fund.

The truth has to be told for an understanding / smooth and successful
receipt of the fund.Some fees / charges will be involved but I don't know
how much that will be involved.Given my situation and health condition,I
will be able to use the little fund available for my drugs and hospital
bills to pay for the procurement of the POA and MOU - agreement documents

As a managers,you should be versed with business acumen to know the kind of
business that will generate investment returns.I don't know your country or
where you are from as such I would not be able to know what business
thrives in your country unless you open up

The documents mentioned earlier are  crucial documents that will be
submitted before the bank can proceed.

The MOU and agreement talks about the terms and Conditions for the
Appointment of the Manager and
Acceptance/Recognition of the Manager, Your roles and duties and conditions
for acceptance

Frankly speaking,if an estimate is given say $1 or $20 then I could be
mistaken but the bank will tell you how much the fee will be.

The business that would be suitable for investment in any country would be
real estate and hospital even though am not familiar with your country or
its business and landscape

I'm not the one preparing the MOU /Agreement but through a lawyer.If you
send your name and Contact address as requested earlier then ,I believe
these answers will be under way. That i gave you a hint of what it entails
does not mean I am the one processing the legal document so i would not
have much to say  but request that you send your name and contact details

If you send the details,it will forward to the appropriate office where the
POA and MOU/Agreement will be drafted and sent to you for proofreading.
When you receive and proofread that you can indicate your acceptance or
otherwise of same…You are not forced or under duress. Its a matter of choice

You asked me and I suggested the line of business I feel that could thrive
 and it does not mean my suggestion is final.

However,you have not even indicated your country to find out if such
business can be invested in such a country but you only ask questions.

All you need do is send me your details

Your full names and contact address.

 The required details will be sent to the lawyer who will draft the POA
,MOU and agreement.It will be sent to you once it is completed then you
read through it. The reading through it is actually proofreading.

When you receive the draft and after reading through,then you can indicate
your acceptance or otherwise of same…You are not forced or under duress.
It's a matter of choice

>

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:
Hello! Thank you for sharing this information with me. Could you please provide more details about the fund and how it came to be deposited in Bank Mandiri Indonesia? I'm curious to learn more about the background of this opportunity.

Best wishes,
Willie

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:
Hello! Thank you for sharing this information with me. It sounds like there are some important steps involved in this process. Could you tell me more about how the fund was originally deposited by your late husband? I'm curious to learn more about the background of this situation.

Best wishes,
Willie

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:
Pls stop further contact. i will not respond to your message because you
are not serious about receiving the fund

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:
Hello! I understand your concern, but I just wanted to share some information with you. Have you heard about alternative ways to receive funds securely? Let me know if you're interested in learning more.

Best wishes,
Willie

subject: Re: Hello Willie/Further Clarification
body:
Hello! I understand your concern, but I just wanted to share some information with you. Can you tell me more about the fund you mentioned?

Best wishes,
Willie
